intro: Peristrophe ciliata, commonly known as the silky peristrophe, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers are often pale pink or white, with a distinctive two-lipped structure. Peristrophe ciliata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of light conditions.
